title: Optimizing Project-Based Learning in Science Inquiry Through Design Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level science theory background (variables, hypotheses, experimental design, etc.) and foundational laboratory experience required
context.additional_context: Mobile device utilization in BYOD environments, emphasizing practical problem-solving skills in science. Focus is on cultivating scientific inquiry abilities through experimental observation, data measurement, and analysis processes.

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five stages of design thinking (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test) to design scientific inquiry projects.
Learners iteratively verify hypotheses by performing at least three feedback cycles using collaborative tools in a mobile microlearning environment.

Learners solve scientific problems by applying three or more problem-solving strategies (e.g., experimental design, data analysis, variable control, collaborative discussion) during a 2–4 week project-based learning process, and submit a portfolio (including strategy explanations, process documentation, and evidence materials) to achieve an "Excellent" rating in at least four of the five teacher evaluation rubric criteria.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
